problem:
Let $a,$ $b,$ $c$ be the roots of $x^3 + px + q = 0.$  Express
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix}\]in terms of $p$ and $q.$
solution:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} &= (1 + a) \begin{vmatrix} 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} + \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 + b \\ 1 & 1 \end{vmatrix} \\
&= (1 + a)((1 + b)(1 + c) - 1) - ((1)(1 + c) - 1) + (1 - (1 + b)) \\
&= abc + ab + ac + bc.
\end{align*}By Vieta's formulas, $ab + ac + bc = p$ and $abc = -q,$ so
\[abc + ab + ac + bc = \boxed{p - q}.\]
model_solution:
To find the determinant of the matrix, we can use the expansion method. 

We have
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix}.\]

Using the expansion along the first row, we get

\[(1 + a) \begin{vmatrix} 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} - 1 \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} + 1 \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 + b \\ 1 & 1 \end{vmatrix}.\]

Expanding the determinants, we get

\[(1 + a)((1 + b)(1 + c) - 1) - ((1)(1 + c) - 1) + (1 - (1 + b)).\]

Simplifying this expression, we get

\[(1 + a)(bc + b + c) - (c) - b.\]

Now, we can expand this expression further:

\[(1 + a)(bc + b + c) - b - c.\]

Since $a, b,$ and $c$ are roots of the polynomial $x^3 + px + q = 0,$ we can use Vieta's formulas, which state that the sum of the roots $a + b + c = 0.$

So, we can rewrite the previous expression:

\[bc + b + c + abc + ab + ac.\]

Using Vieta's formulas, we can rewrite the expression as

\[bc + ab + ac + abc.\]

But, again by Vieta's formulas, $ab + ac + bc = p.$ Also, $abc = -q.$ Therefore, the expression becomes

\[p - q.\]

So, 

\[\boxed{p - q.}\]
